Data.event_text: Five female members of the same family are fatally stabbed in a suspected honour killing by a relative in Lucknow.

links.text: -"U.P. man kills mother, four young sisters to 'save their honour'". The Hindu. 1 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: The body of journalist Mukesh Chandrakar, who went missing on 1 January, is found inside a septic tank at a compound belonging to a road construction contractor in Bijapur, Chhattisgarh.

links.text: -"Body of missing Indian journalist found in septic tank". BBC. 3 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: 5 January  An HAL Dhruv helicopter of the Indian Coast Guard crashes during a training flight in Porbandar, Gujarat, killing three crew members.

links.text: -"Coast guard helicopter crashes in Gujarat during training, 3 dead". Hindustan Times. 5 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: The first HMPV Virus case in India is detected in Bengaluru.

links.text: -"HMPV in India, new cases identified: All about symptoms, treatment and how to remain safe". Times Of India. January 7, 2025. Retrieved January 7, 2025.-

Data.event_text: Nine people, including eight police officers, are killed after their vehicle hits a landmine planted by Naxalites in Bijapur district, Chhattisgarh.

links.text: -"Nine killed in a roadside bomb attack in central India". Al Jazeera. 6 January 2025. Retrieved 7 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: Nine miners are killed in the flooding of a coal mine in Dima Hasao district, Assam.

links.text: -"India rescuers race to save men stuck in flooded 'rat-hole' mine". BBC. 6 January 2025. Retrieved 20 February 2025.-
-"Search for missing India miners ends as bodies recovered after 44 days". BBC. 6 January 2025. Retrieved 20 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 9 January  At least six people are killed and many others are injured in a stampede at the Venkateswara Temple, Tirumala in Tirupati, Andhra Pradesh.

links.text: -"Miscommunication or Negligence? What Triggered Tirupati Stampede That Claimed 6 Lives". Times Now. 9 January 2025. Retrieved 9 January 2025.-
-"Overwhelming Rush Of Pilgrims": Witnesses Recall Tirupati Stampede". NDTV. 9 January 2025. Retrieved 9 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: 10 January  Larsen & Toubro chairman S. N. Subrahmanyan's statement on a 90-hour work week and working day on Sunday sparks outrage and debate on worklife balance.

links.text: -""What Do You Do Sitting At Home": L&T Chairman Suggests Working Sundays". NDTV. 2025-01-10. Retrieved 2025-01-10.-

Data.event_text: 13 January  The Z-Morh Tunnel in Jammu and Kashmir is inaugurated in a ceremony attended by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

links.text: -"India's Modi inaugurates a strategic tunnel in disputed Kashmir". AP News. 2025-01-13. Retrieved 2025-01-13.-

Data.event_text: 13 January26 FebruaryÂ  2025 Prayag Maha Kumbh Mela.

links.text: -"Fire burns through multiple tents at Maha Kumbh festival but causes no injuries". AP News. 2025-01-20. Retrieved 2025-01-20.-
-"India's vast Hindu festival draws to an end". France 24. 2025-02-26. Retrieved 2025-02-26.-

Data.event_text: 16 January  Actor Saif Ali Khan is stabbed by an unknown man during an alleged robbery at his Mumbai residence.

links.text: -"Bollywood star Saif Ali Khan out of danger after being stabbed". BBC India. 16 January 2025. Retrieved 16 January 2025.-
-"Bollywood Star Saif Ali Khan Stabbed Multiple Times in Mumbai Home Invasion Attack". Variety. 16 January 2025. Retrieved 16 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: 18 January  Sanjay Roy is convicted by the   Sealdah court in Kolkata for the 2024 Kolkata rape and murder case.

links.text: -"Indian police volunteer convicted of rape, murder of a trainee doctor that led to protests". AP News. 18 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: 19 January  A fire caused by an exploding gas cylinder destroys at least 18 temporary tents at the 2025 Prayag Kumbh Mela festival grounds. No injuries are reported.

links.text: -"Fire burns through multiple tents at Maha Kumbh festival but causes no injuries". AP News. 20 January 2025. Archived from the original on 28 January 2025. Retrieved 29 January 2025.-
-"Fire burns through multiple tents at Maha Kumbh festival but causes no injuries". AP News. 20 January 2025. Archived from the original on 28 January 2025. Retrieved 29 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: 20 January  The Sealdah Court in Kolkata sentences Sanjay Roy to rigorous life imprisonment following his conviction in the 2024 Kolkata rape and murder case.

links.text: -""Not Rarest Of Rare": RG Kar Rape-Murder Convict Sentenced To Life In Jail - Updates". NDTV. 2025-01-20. Retrieved 2025-01-20.-

Data.event_text: 22 January  Thirteen people are killed and 15 others are injured after a passenger train collides with a group of people that disembarked from another train following a false fire alarm near Pachora, Maharashtra.

links.text: -"Thirteen passengers killed by another train after fleeing fire rumour alarm". BBC. 23 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: 24 January  Eight people are killed in an explosion at an ordnance factory in Bhandara district, Maharashtra.

links.text: -"Eight people killed in ordnance factory explosion in western India". Reuters. 24 January 2025. Retrieved 24 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: 29 January  At least 30 people are killed in a crowd crush at the 2025 Prayag Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj.

links.text: -"Survivors of India festival stampede recount deadly crush". France 24. 30 January 2025. Retrieved 2025-01-30.-

Data.event_text: 2 February  A bus carrying pilgrims falls into a gorge near Saputara, Gujarat, killing five people and injuring 35 others.

links.text: -"5 pilgrims killed, 35 hurt as bus falls into Gujarat gorge". The Times of India. ISSNÂ 0971-8257. Retrieved 2025-02-04.-
-"5 pilgrims killed, 35 hurt as bus falls into Gujarat gorge". The Times of India. ISSNÂ 0971-8257. Retrieved 2025-02-04.-

Data.event_text: 5 February  2025 Delhi Legislative Assembly election The Bharatiya Janata Party wins a two-thirds majority in the Delhi Legislative Assembly.

links.text: -"Modi's BJP wins big in high-stakes Delhi election". BBC. Retrieved 2025-02-08.-

Data.event_text: 6 February  A Dassault Mirage 2000 fighter jet of the Indian Air Force crashes in Shivpuri district, Madhya Pradesh. The two pilots on board eject safely.

links.text: -"IAF's Mirage 2000 fighter jet crashes near Shivpuri in Madhya Pradesh, pilots safely ejected". The Hindu. 2025-02-06. ISSNÂ 0971-751X. Retrieved 2025-02-11.-
-"IAF's Mirage 2000 fighter jet crashes near Shivpuri in Madhya Pradesh, pilots safely ejected". The Hindu. 2025-02-06. ISSNÂ 0971-751X. Retrieved 2025-02-11.-

Data.event_text: Thirty-one Naxalites and two military personnel are killed in the 2025 Bijapur clash.

links.text: -"31 Maoists Killed, 2 Security Personnel Dead In Chhattisgarh Encounter". NDTTV. Retrieved 2025-02-09.-

Data.event_text: N. Biren Singh resigns as the Chief Minister Of Manipur amid ongoing ethnic violence in the state.

links.text: -"Biren Singh Quits As Chief Minister 2 Years After Manipur Violence Began". NDTV. 9 February 2025. Retrieved 9 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 10 February  Ranveer Allahabadia's remarks on the show India's Got Latent sparks nation-wide outrage and debate on free speech and laws on obscene content on social media.

links.text: -"YouTuber's 'dirty' comments spark massive row in India". BBC India. 20 February 2025. Retrieved 20 February 2025.-
-"Ranveer Allahbadia controversy: When does a joke stop being funny?". India Today. 11 February 2025. Retrieved 11 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 13 February  The Union Government imposes President's rule in Manipur amid ongoing ethnic violence in the state.

links.text: -"Direct rule in violence-hit Indian state after chief minister quits". BBC. 13 February 2025. Retrieved 13 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 14 February  A series of police raids on bookstores are carried out in Jammu and Kashmir, resulting in the seizure of 668 books released by a publishing house associated with the outlawed Islamic organisation Jamaat-e-Islami.

links.text: -"Police in disputed Kashmir raid bookstores, seizing books related to Islamic group". AP News. 19 February 2025. Retrieved 19 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: An SUV carrying pilgrims to the 2025 Prayag Maha Kumbh Mela collides with a bus in Prayagraj, killing all ten people aboard the SUV.

links.text: -"10 dead after bus crashes into pilgrims' vehicle in Prayagraj, probe underway". Kalinga TV. 2025-02-15. Retrieved 2025-02-15.-

Data.event_text: At least 18 people are killed in a crowd crush at New Delhi railway station.

links.text: -"Eighteen killed in New Delhi station crush". BBC. 15 February 2025. Retrieved 16 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 19 February  The BJP names Rekha Gupta as Chief Minister of Delhi.

links.text: -"Indian prime minister's party names a woman as top government official in New Delhi state". AP News. 19 February 2025. Retrieved 20 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: The Invest Kerala Global Summit is held by the Kerala state government.

links.text: -"Invest Kerala Global Summit: Getting bizzy with the future". New Indian Express. 21 February 2025. Retrieved 21 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: The Drugs Controller General of India orders a ban on the manufacture and export of the opioids tapentadol and carisoprodol following reports of widespread addiction and deaths caused by the said drugs in West African countries.

links.text: -"India bans two opioids behind crisis in West Africa". BBC. 23 February 2025. Retrieved 23 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: An SUV crashes into a truck near Dhanbad while traveling to the 2025 Prayag Maha Kumbh Mela, killing six people and injuring two others.

links.text: -"6 Kumbh pilgrims from Bengal killed in Dhanbad". The Times of India. ISSNÂ 0971-8257. Retrieved 2025-02-24.-
-"6 Kumbh pilgrims from Bengal killed in Dhanbad". The Times of India. ISSNÂ 0971-8257. Retrieved 2025-02-24.-

Data.event_text: The Srisaliam Left Bank Canal collapses in Nagarkurnool district, Telangana, leaving eight workers missing.

links.text: -"Race against time to save eight Indian workers trapped inside tunnel". BBC. Retrieved 2025-02-26.-

Data.event_text: 26 February  An army truck is attacked by militants in Rajouri district, Jammu and Kashmir.

links.text: -"Army Truck Targeted In Jammu And Kashmir's Rajouri, No Reports Of Damage". NDTV. 26 February 2025. Retrieved 26 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 28 February  An avalanche hits a Border Roads Organisation camp in Mana, Uttarakhand, killing eight people.

links.text: -"Eight dead in India avalanche as rescue operation ends". France 24. Retrieved 2025-03-02.-

Data.event_text: 1 March  Delhi orders a ban on vehicles aged 10 years and above from refuelling inside city limits effective 31 March due to air pollution concerns.

links.text: -"Delhi bans old cars from refuelling to help tackle city's pollution". France 24. Retrieved 2025-03-02.-

Data.event_text: A SEPECAT Jaguar of the Indian Air Force crashes during a training exercise in Panchkula district, Haryana. The pilot ejects safely.

links.text: -"Jaguar fighter aircraft from Ambala air base crashes in Panchkula, pilot ejects safely". The Indian Express. 2025-03-07. Retrieved 2025-03-08.-

Data.event_text: An Antonov An-32 of the Indian Air Force crashes on landing at Bagdogra Airport in West Bengal. No fatalities are reported.

links.text: -Kumari, Sweety (2025-03-07). "Indian Air Force's AN-32 craft crash lands in West Bengal's Bagdogra airport, crew safe". The Indian Express. Retrieved 2025-03-08.-

Data.event_text: 9 March  India wins the 2025 ICC Champions Trophy for a record third time, in Dubai.

links.text: -"Rohit, Rahul, spinners lead India to third Champions Trophy title". ESPNcricinfo. Retrieved 2025-03-09.-

Data.event_text: 17 March  2025 Nagpur violence At least 30 people are injured in clashes demanding the removal of the tomb of the Mughal emperor Aurangzeb in Nagpur, Maharashtra.

links.text: -Kumar, Pradip (19 March 2025). "65 rioters arrested, curfew imposed in Nagpur". Hindustan Times. Retrieved 19 March 2025.-

Data.event_text: 18 March  Three people are convicted and sentenced to death by a special court in Mainpuri for the killing of 24 Dalits in the village of Dehuli, Uttar Pradesh in 1981.

links.text: -Imam, Saiyed Moziz (19 March 2025). "Three men sentenced to death in India for 1981 caste massacre". BBC. Retrieved 20 March 2025.-

Data.event_text: 20 March  Thirty Naxalites and one military personnel are killed in clashes between police and naxalites in Dantewada district and Kanker district, Chhattisgarh.

links.text: -"30 Naxalites, cop killed in two encounters in Chhattisgarh". ThePrint. 20 March 2025. Retrieved 30 March 2025.-

Data.event_text: 27 March  Four police officers and three militants are killed in clashes in Kathua District, Jammu and Kashmir.

links.text: -"At least 4 police, 3 suspected militants killed in Kashmir fighting". AP News. 28 March 2025. Retrieved 28 March 2025.-

Data.event_text: 29 March  Sixteen Naxalites are killed in clashes with police in Sukma district, Chattisgarh.

links.text: -"Indian police kill 16 Maoists in gunfight". The Telegraph. 29 March 2025. Retrieved 29 March 2025.-

Data.event_text: 30 March  Eleven cars of a Bengaluru-Kamakhya train derail near Nirgundi Train Station in Cuttack, killing one person and injuring eight others.

links.text: -"Kamakhya Train Accident: Rescue Ops Underway After Bangalore-Kamakhya Superfast Express Derails". NDTV. 30 March 2025.-

Data.event_text: 31 March  Eight members of the same family are killed in an explosion caused by a gas cylinder at a house that doubled as an illegal firecracker factory in Patharpratima, West Bengal.

links.text: -"BJP slams TMC government, demands NIA probe as blast at firecracker unit kills eight". Deccan Herald. 2 April 2025.-

Data.event_text: At least 21 people are killed in an explosion at an illegal fireworks factory in Deesa, Gujarat.

links.text: -"18 Dead In India Firework Factory Blast: Officials". Barron's. Retrieved 1 April 2025.-
-"'Water break saved me from blast that killed my brother in India'". BBC. Retrieved 2 April 2025.-

Data.event_text: Two trains collide near Sahebganj, Jharkhand, killing two people and injuring four others.

links.text: -"2 loco pilots dead, 4 injured as goods trains operated by NTPC collide head-on in Jharkhand". The Times of India.-

Data.event_text: 8 April  Murshidabad violence Three people are killed in clashes in protest against The Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025 in Murshidabad, West Bengal.

links.text: -"3 Killed In Bengal Waqf Protests, Court Orders Deployment Of Central Forces". NDTV. Retrieved 2025-04-12.-

Data.event_text: 10 April  Tahawwur Hussain Rana, a Pakistani-born Canadian national and terrorist wanted by India for his role in the 26/11 attacks, arrives in Delhi following his arrest and extradition from the United States.

links.text: -"Mumbai terror attacks accused extradited by US arrives in India". BBC. Retrieved 10 April 2025.-

Data.event_text: 19 April  Eleven people are killed in the collapse of a residential building in New Delhi.

links.text: -"At Least 11 Killed In India Building Collapse". Barron's. Retrieved 20 April 2025.-

Data.event_text: 21 April  The Central Government declares a three-day state mourning period over the death of Pope Francis.

links.text: -"India to observe 3-day stater mourning on passing of Pope Francis". Hindustan Times. Retrieved 2025-04-22.-

Data.event_text: 22 April  2025 Pahalgam attack At least 28 people are killed in an attack by militants on a group of tourists visiting Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir.

links.text: -"More than 20 killed after gunmen open fire on tourists in Indian-administered Kashmir". BBC. Retrieved 2025-04-22.-
